title: Synthetic Division
text: We must divide $$2x^3-9x^2+13x-6$$ by x-1 using synthetic division as shown (from Emath). This gives us $$2x^2-7x+6$$.\n##figure1.gif##

title: Factoring the Quadratic
text: We must now factor the quadratic from the previous step: $$2x^2-7x+6=(2x-3)(x-2)$$

title: Solving for the Zeros
text: If we put together all the factors, we have (x-1)(2x-3)(x-2). This means that x=1,3/2, and 2.
